class.name: ScheduledAudioStreamPlayer2D
class.brief_description: A node for scheduled audio playback.
class.description: Behaves similarly to [AudioStreamPlayer2D] but can schedule audio to play in the future. See also [ScheduledAudioStreamPlayer] to play a scheduled sound non-positionally.

method.name: play_scheduled
method.description: Schedules a sound to be played on the [AudioServer]'s timeline at [param absolute_time] in seconds. If the sound is scheduled to play earlier than the value returned by [method AudioServer.get_absolute_time], it will be played immediately. The sound starts from the given [param from_position] in seconds. Use this method for high precision playbacks, such as a metronome or other rhythm-based sounds. Returns an [AudioStreamPlaybackScheduled] instance representing the scheduled playback of the sound. [b]Note:[/b] Calling this method after [member AudioStreamPlayer2D.max_polyphony] is reached will cut off the oldest sound playing on this node. [b]Note:[/b] On the Web platform, [member AudioStreamPlayer2D.playback_type] must be set to [constant AudioServer.PLAYBACK_TYPE_STREAM]. Otherwise, this method will behave like [method AudioStreamPlayer2D.play].
